name: Accenture + OpenAI
title: 40,000 Enterprise Licenses Partnership

classification.classificationRationale: Accenture has a formal AI practice and functions as an enabler for client organizations, fitting Model 2 (CoE). The 40,000 ChatGPT Enterprise license deployment to its own workforce has characteristics of Model 6a (Enterprise-Wide Adoption). Classified as Model 2 because Accenture's primary structural role is enabling/advising, not because its internal deployment pattern is CoE-like. Low confidence due to insufficient data about Accenture's internal AI organizational structure.

description:
Accenture is rolling out 40,000 ChatGPT Enterprise licenses and naming OpenAI its primary intelligence partner. This represents one of the largest enterprise AI deployments through a consulting partnership.
- Partnership model: OpenAI partners with Accenture to reach enterprises through trusted consulting relationships
- Accenture brings change management, implementation, and industry expertise; OpenAI brings model capabilities
- 40,000 licenses for transforming Accenture's own workforce—'learn by doing' model
- Consultants become AI-fluent through daily usage before advising clients
- Government extension: UK Ministry of Justice rolled out ChatGPT Enterprise; 'Humphrey' and 'Consult' AI tools for Whitehall

observableMarkers.metrics: OpenAI: 1M business customers ('fastest-growing business platform in history'). Enterprise users save 40-60 minutes/day. 75% of enterprises report positive ROI (Wharton study).

mechanisms.name: Put Executives on the Tools
mechanisms.evidence: 40,000 ChatGPT Enterprise licenses deployed to consultants with 'learn by doing' model — consultants become AI-fluent through daily usage before advising clients.

layers.label: Curation Review
layers.summary: Bulk curation review reassessed classification. The specimen describes Accenture's partnership with OpenAI deploying 40,000 ChatGPT Enterprise licenses internally. Decision tree walk: Accenture has formal AI practice → central team enables others (consultants) → Model 2 (CoE). However, the 40K license deployment is more like enterprise-wide adoption (6a). Kept as Model 2 given Accenture's primary function as enabler/advisor, but noted the tension. Confidence downgraded to Low due to thin structural data about Accenture's own AI organization. Fixed industry. Removed spurious quote.

layers.label: Initial Documentation
layers.summary: Accenture is rolling out 40,000 ChatGPT Enterprise licenses and naming OpenAI its primary intelligence partner. This represents one of the largest enterprise AI deployments through a consulting partnership.

openQuestions: What is Accenture's internal AI organizational structure — does it have a dedicated AI practice or CoE?
How does the OpenAI partnership differ from Accenture's other AI vendor relationships?
What metrics does Accenture track for consultant AI adoption and proficiency?
taxonomyFeedback: Professional services firms present a classification challenge: they both deploy AI internally (potentially 6a) and function as AI enablers for clients (Model 2). The specimen conflates these two dimensions. May need a clearer framework for classifying consulting firms.
The 'partnership specimen' format (Accenture + OpenAI) may be less useful than separate specimens for each org's internal structure.
